subject: Business
title: Porter's Five Forces
description: A fast breakdown of Porter's Five Forces for builders.

hook.text: Why are airlines barely profitable while software companies mint money? Michael Porter has the answer.

buildup.text: Five forces shape every industry's profitability: rivalry, new entrants, substitutes, buyers, and suppliers.

discovery.text: Airlines face brutal rivalry, low switching costs, and powerful suppliers (Boeing, fuel). Profits evaporate.

twist.text: Software has high switching costs, few substitutes, and weak buyer power. The forces protect profits.

climax.text: Strategy isn't just about beating competitors. It's about choosing an industry where the forces favor you.

punchline.text: Don't just win the game. Pick a game you can win.

quiz.question: What are Porter's Five Forces designed to assess?
options: The competitive forces shaping an industry's profitability
A company's internal strengths and weaknesses
The best marketing channels for a product
